intro: Anemonoides extremiorientalis, commonly known as the Eastern Anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically features a hairy stem and palmate leaves with a distinctive, divided appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
